intro: Onosma visianii, commonly known as the Persian sandthrift, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and the Middle East. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, blue to violet flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Onosma visianii is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
